document_data.name: Harissa Chopeta
document_data.mainbody:
'''Harissa Chopeta''' was a beggar, or possibly, a refugee, from the city of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Sorry. I'm just so hungry. This is the only place I can get anything to eat.''|Tooralooralayo}}
document_data.Description: Harissa was a [[human]] woman with a light skin and dark brown eyes. She wore a cloth skullcap and a humble commoner's tunic.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, [[Spatula Farggo]], a worker from the [[Elfsong Tavern]]'s kitchens, began helping out the beggars in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]], by bringing them kitchen scraps and leftovers to those in need, both locals, and the refugees fleeing fro the armies of [[the Absolute]]. Harissa Chopeta was among the recipients of the scraps, at the back of the tavern. She was desperate for handouts as the Elfsong scraps were the only source of food for the woman.
